description.narrative: Child Protection Sector Coordiantion, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ General, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children at risk of violence, abuse and exploitation benefit from improved prevention, protection and response interventions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to lead the coordination of the CP Area of Responsibility in Syria, with gaps analysis, strategic planning and a more cohesive response while also contributing to greater sector's visibility and accountability. CP coordination worked on two fronts: the Syria hub, making up the largest portion of the response in complementarity with the other two hubs; within Syria, the coordination focused on improving the intra-hub coordination at the national and sub national level to enhance child protection response across the field offices and sectors. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of Sector/sub-sector meetings/workshop and trainings at national and sub-national level
